sub_topic: Finding the average value of a trigonometric function
message_1:
A mountain has a peak that is 10,000 feet high. The angle of elevation from a point on the ground to the top of the mountain is measured every hour of the day for one week. The measurements in degrees are as follows: 25, 35, 45, 55, 65, 75, and 85. 

What is the average angle of elevation to the top of the mountain over the course of the week (in degrees)?
message_2:
To find the average angle of elevation, we need to add up all the angle measurements and then divide by the number of measurements.

Sum of angles = 25 + 35 + 45 + 55 + 65 + 75 + 85 = 385 degrees

Number of measurements = 7

Average angle of elevation = (Sum of angles) / (Number of measurements) = 385 / 7 = 55 degrees

The average angle of elevation to the top of the mountain over the course of the week is 55 degrees.
